result.execSummary:
The defendant Laif J Bever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
09/01/2022 CORRECTED TO INDICATE 40 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT, NOT 4.

superMiscConds.notes: Must register as a sex offender for 15 years. Must complete sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommendations. Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

Must have no contact with victim or her family in any way. May not have any contact with juvenile females unless they are in the presence of their parent or guardian. May not use any electronic device with internet capabilities without permission of agent.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

records.addlTxt:
2:28 PM Defendant Laif J Bever in court, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Laif J Bever.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appears by zoom.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 21CM203 AND 22CF33

2:30  Court relates and gives appearances.  Court questions Atty. Rockow regarding PSI.
2:32  Court questions State regarding PSI.
2:32  State relates.
2:33  M.B. makes statement.  2:43 R.B. makes statement.
2:58  Therapist Nikki G. called, sworn, direct by Atty. Rockow.  
3:08  Cross by State.
3:11  State relates and gives recommendation.
3:20  Atty. Rockow makes argument.
3:27  Laif Bever makes statement.
3:28  Court relates.

21CM203
Count #1:  40 days jail to run concurrent with sentence in 22CF33 with credit for 40 days served
Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

22CF33
Count #1
3 years and 6 months Wisconsin Prison System as follows: 1 years and 6 months initial confinement; 2 years and 0 months extended supervision.  Dodge Correctional is reception facility.
Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP but not Substance Abuse Program.
Must complete sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommendations.
Must register as sex offender for 15 years.
Defendant must have no contact with victim or her family in any way.
Successfully complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up ordered by PO.
May not have any contact with juvenile females unless they are in the presence of their parent or guardian.
May not use any electronic device with internet capabilities without permission of agent.
Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

Voter rights ineligibility given.
Written explanation of determinate sentence given.


(MS SCANNED TO JAIL)

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laif J Bever in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Laif J Bever. This covers cases 22CF33 & 21CM203.  

Court relates regarding letter from corrections regarding DE not cooperating.  Attorney Rockow relates.  State relates DE recently met with Agent Hagen on Monday and the report would not be completed by today.  State moves to revoke bail. Argument by Attorney Rockow.  

Court relates and revokes bond in both cases.  Sentencing hearing set for 8/30/2022 at 2:30 PM.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Response from Judge Babler to Stephanie Schmidt RE:  Sentencing date
Letter to Judge Babler from DOC regarding PSI.
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Request to reset hearing due to treatment court meeting before another Judge.

Sentence hearing set for same time as 21CM203; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laif J Bever in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Laif J Bever. 
Covers 22CF33 and 21CM203

22CF33 Reading of Information waived. Not guilty plea entered. Must appear in person for next date.

Both cases set for plea hearing on June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Laif J Bever appeared by video, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Laif J Bever. 
9:19 Jon Fick, Deputy with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 9:24 No cross by defense. 9:24 Court questions witnesses.  
9:26 Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
